content.description:
The farthest left of all the free routes at the crag, also the most difficult. It starts with a couple unprotected moves to a juggy rail, traverse right on the rail to the first bolt and from there it is hard to the top. The crux starts at a bulge near the 5th bolt. Very thin and technical climbing to the chains. Originally graded 11d until a hold broke at the crux.

Left of Pneumonic. It's the longest route on the cliff and you can rap down, get lowered or walk off from the top.
Bolts

Climb rusty rivets and drilled BAT hook holes to the left of 'Critical Mass'. The first hook move above the 5th rivet is a bit tenous as the rock is overhanging and the hook hangs off the rock and moves around if you are not careful on it. Some rivets are very rusty and/or thin.

Just left of Critical Mass.
Wire hangers on rivets...

A beautiful, classic route. Pnuemonic is probably the nicest and most popular route at Roadside Attraction. It is the overhanging arete to the Right of Critical Mass and begins above a short unprotected slab. Climbing is mostly just left of the arete. The route is fairly sustained in difficulty from the base of the arete until the 5th bolt where a jug flake to the right of the arete provides easier climbing to the rap hangers on top.  This route is excellent so give it a shot even if you don't think you can do it!

This route is very solidly bolted with the exception of the slab below the first bolt. Hint: If you are scared on the slab don't even try the rest of the route.

Follows the line of bolts up the lower angle right hand side of the Pneumonic arete.  Technical slabby face climbing.  Great route if it's clean.  Currently needs a scrub.

Bolts, chain anchor

Start at the base of the grim chasm.  Face climb and stem up to the ramp and crack to the chains.  Needs scrub.  A surprisingly good climb.

Right of up the Roadside Arete
Mixed climbing, chain anchor.

A nice and easy to find area beetween Agassiz and Mission 2 minutes from Highway #7. The routes here are all bolted sport climbs and range from 5.9 to 5.11d. The crag is east facing and therefore is sunny all morning and some of the afternoon. It is not usually crowded but there may be a couple of other climbers there when you arrive. All the climbs are also accesible by hiking a rough trail to the top and therefore can be top-roped without a leader setting the routes.
